column4: i just did an update and now i can't fscking load nvidia kernel modules
i used envyng
of if you used envyng yu need to rerun it while booted in the new kernel
change xorg.conf so driver is nv not nvidia, boot to new kernel
i do the same thing, you gotta do that each time you update kernel
i have that issue every time i upgrade the kernel, its the only downside of envyng i can see
no, envyng will only out the relevant module in the kernel you are running
if you run uname -a it will tell you when your kernel came out
im on -21
well its september now there may be a new one
change your xorg.conf to read nv for your graphics driver
then run gksu envyng-gtk
and reinstall
if I can modprobe nvidia without any errors, that means my proprietary modules are all good, no?
not sure, I always get no x server if i reboot after envyng without changing my xorg.conf first
then dmesg will output useful stuff
go suggest it in the bug tracker
try logs and dmesg
